fields.description:
Currently the branches and tags autocomplete data is supplied via a JS array in a page script. This data is unbounded and can be very expensive to get.

A page size bound autocomplete that is made as an ajax request will reduce memory and contention issues.

SearchRepositoryServletParams.get/set Branches and Tags should be removed.
fields.summary: ajaxify Search Form branches and tags autocomplete

fields.description:
See https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4034#c35106 as a more refined solution for CRUC-4195.

{quote}
13 Sep
Tom Davies says:
I don't like the fact that you have to modify TotalityFilter each time you add a...

I don't like the fact that you have to modify TotalityFilter each time you add an admin GWT service.

I think that all GWT endpoints should be in the handlesOwnSecurity category, with the AdminSecurityAspect protecting the admin services, and the others making explicit checks (which they do now anyway I think).

We could put a test equivalent to the TotalityFilter requiresLogin test in the GWT dispatcher, and add an @AnonymousAllowed annotation which services could add to avoid the check - the gwt admin endpoints would need to do that. Then we'd have the same security we have now, without needing to modify TotalityFilter.
{quote}
fields.summary: Implement @AnonymousAllowed annotation for GWT Services
there is no scrollbar for diffs in FF

fields.description:
Consider this example: 

I have two project A and B, and I want to set up two groups to give access to those projects - Group-A can see Project A and Group-B can see Project B. 

Currently to restrict the permissions on the project a separate permission scheme needs to be created for each project that gives view permission to the correct groups. 

It would be nice if you could introduce a variable say ${ProjectKey} in the permission schemes that would be expanded with the project key when the permission checks are resolved: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20100921-dscjipscn74gh1kaymjfeimfnu.jpg!  

Then I could create groups in the form Group-<Project Key> and have a single permission scheme for all projects.
fields.summary: Parameterised group names in permission schemes
Split crucible tree by branch as well as source

fields.description:
When you write a comment, the details panel doesn't update your last comment or number of comments.

Screenshot:  Nick (currentUser()) has a general comment, but the details table shows blanks for him.

Not sure this is trivial to fix: 

The Comment object needs a field linking it to its author so we can update the table without an AJAX request.  Currently that data is only stored in the response object from the AJAX request to reload comments.

Alternatively, we can decorate the current user's row in the table with a "me" class and then update that row as the current user makes changes.  This method makes the defect/comment listing a bit harder though because we'd have to parse the "2 (1 defect)" string.  Also not as clean.
fields.summary: Details table not updated when you write a comment.

fields.description:
Currently crucible.css is overwriting a lot of the css rules from style.css that pertain to the directory navigation tree in the left column.  For example, crucible has ".tree span.folder" as "display: block" where FE is leaving it as the default inline.  FE has 2px more left padding on filenames than Crucible.

It should be pretty straightforward to get these back into a shared set of CSS rules which would reduce code and maintenance cost.
fields.summary: Code Debt: Crucible and FishEye should share more CSS Rules

fields.description:
Its looking for database drivers in FISHEYE_INST/lib: 

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:fecru-2.3.5]$ ./bin/fisheyectl.sh restore -t postgresql -j jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5433/fisheye -f backup/backup_2010-20-09_1211.zip -u username -p password --sql --force
ERROR - Unable to connect to PostgreSQL database jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5433/fisheye: 
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.postgresql.Driver: 
is the database driver jar file properly installed in the FISHEYE_INST/lib directory?

Cannot open target database at: jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5433/fisheye 
(Unable to connect to PostgreSQL database jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5433/fisheye: 
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.postgresql.Driver: 
is the database driver jar file properly installed in the FISHEYE_INST/lib directory?)
{noformat}

The workaround is to copy the driver JAR files from {{FISHEYE_HOME/lib/dbdrivers}} into {{FISHEYE_INST/lib}}.
fields.summary: fisheyectl restore fails when restoring to an external database
